sections.title: Section I
sections.directions: Each question or incomplete statement is followed by four suggested answers. Select the best answer in each case.

questions.question: Products of anaerobic respiration in plants include
Respiration always involves
Which of the following results in accumulation of lactic acid in muscles when its supply is insufficient?
In order to respire aerobically, an organism needs
Respiratory rate increases when jumping because
selectableOptions: jumping makes the heart beat faster.

questions.question: Which of the following would produce the greatest oxygen debt?
During expiration
selectableOptions: Rib cage moves outwards and upwards.
Volume of the thoracic cavity reduces.
questions.wordAnswer: Volume of the thoracic cavity reduces.

sections.title: Section II
sections.directions: Each question or incomplete statement is followed by four suggested answers. Select the best answer in each case.

questions.question: Which of the following requires the most amount of oxygen?
Which of the following acts as the site for gaseous exchange in the lungs?
The product of anaerobic respiration most useful in baking is
The product of anaerobic respiration most useful in brewing is
After vigorous exercise, the lactic acid in muscles of an athlete is converted to
Which structure protects the lungs?

Which of the following helps to move trapped dust particles and bacteria up the trachea?
Gaseous exchange in lung occurs by
which of the following produces the highest amount of energy when oxidized?

sections.title: Section III
sections.directions:
Each question consists of three responses. 
One or more of the response(s) is or are correct. 
Select: 
A. If 1, 2 and 3 are all correct. 
B. If 1 and 2 only are correct. 
C. If 2 and 3 only are correct. 
D. If 1 only is correct.

questions.question: Characteristics of a good respiratory surface
nonSelectableOptions: It must be moist for respiratory gases to dissolve and diffuses easily.
It must be thin to reduce the distance for diffusion of respiratory gases.
It must have a small surface area to volume ratio

questions.question: Respiratory substrates include
Inspired air differs from expired air in that
nonSelectableOptions: Inspired air contains more carbon dioxide.

questions.question: Respiration differs from photosynthesis in that
During anaerobic respiration

sections.title: Section IV
sections.directions:
Each question consists of a First and Second statements. 
Choose: 
A. If both statements are true and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first. 
B. If both statements are true and the second statement is not a correct explanation of the first. 
C. If the first statement is true and the second statement is false. 
D. If the first statement is false and the second statement is true.

twoStatements: The rate of respiration is higher in a rat than in an elephant.
A rat loses more heat to the surrounding than an elephant.
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first

twoStatements: Aerobic respiration takes place in the cytoplasm.
Aerobic respiration produces more energy than anaerobic respiration.
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: First statement is False. Second statement is True

twoStatements: Plants respire but do not breath.
At night plants take in oxygen and send out carbon dioxide.
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first

twoStatements: Alveolus is the respiratory surface in man.
Alveoli is made up of columnar epithelial cells.
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: First statement is True. Second statement is False

twoStatements: Inspired air is cooler than expired air.
Some energy produced during tissue respiration is lost as heat.
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first

sections.title: Section V
sections.directions:
Each question consists of four lettered headings A, B, C and D. 
Select the heading which is closely related to the description.

questions.question: A set of muscular movements used by animals to keep a gaseous exchange surface supplied with oxygen, and to remove carbon dioxide from the gaseous exchange surface.
It occurs only in the presence of oxygen
The volume of air that moves into and out of the lungs during normal breathing.
The volume of air that remains in the lungs after maximum expiration.
It controls breathing rate.
It Produces most of the energy in aerobic organisms.
The maximum volume of air that can be expired after maximum inspiration.
The maximum volume of air that can be drawn into the lungs after breathing in normally.
The maximum volume of air that can be sent out of the lungs after breathing out normally.
It is not normally respired by a healthy mammal

sections.title: Section VI
sections.directions: Each question or incomplete statement is followed by four suggested answers. Select the best answer in each case.

questions.question: The apparatus below is used to find out if carbon dioxide is released during aerobic respiration by a small mammal. What is the name of the solution in flask D?
The apparatus below is used to find out if carbon dioxide is released during aerobic respiration by a small mammal. What is the name of the solution in flask A?
The apparatus below is used to find out if carbon dioxide is released during aerobic respiration by a small mammal. What is the role of the solution in flask D?
selectableOptions: To detect carbon dioxide in the air coming from bottle C.
To remove carbon dioxide from the incoming air.
To produce oxygen used by the small mammal.
questions.wordAnswer: To detect carbon dioxide in the air coming from bottle C.

questions.question: The apparatus below is used to find out if carbon dioxide is released during aerobic respiration by a small mammal. What is the role of the solution in flask A?
selectableOptions: To remove carbon dioxide from the incoming air.
To remove oxygen from the incoming air.
To remove water vapour from the incoming air
To produce oxygen used by the small mammal.
questions.wordAnswer: To remove carbon dioxide from the incoming air.

questions.question: The apparatus below is used to find out if carbon dioxide is released during aerobic respiration by a small mammal. What color change in flask D would indicate the presence carbon dioxide?
selectableOptions: Solution in D turns Blue black.

questions.question: The apparatus below is used to find out if carbon dioxide is released during aerobic respiration by a small mammal. Suggest a suitable control for this experiment.
selectableOptions: Animal in bottle C is removed.
Animal in bottle C is killed and sterilized.
questions.wordAnswer: Animal in bottle C is killed and sterilized.

questions.question: The apparatus below is used to find out if carbon dioxide is released during aerobic respiration by a small mammal. What precaution must be taken if the animal in bottle C is replaced by a plant?
selectableOptions: Place alkaline pyrogallic acid in flask A.
Spread paraffin oil on the mouth of flask A, B and D.
Cover bottle C with a dark cloth.
Cover bottle C with a transparent cloth.
questions.wordAnswer: Cover bottle C with a dark cloth.

questions.question: The presence of mucus in the trachea of humans is
selectableOptions: To detect the presence of bacteria

questions.question: The presence of carbon dioxide in inspired air is indicated by
Its percentage is the same in inspired and expired air.
